ETYMOLOGY: From Italian influenza 'influence' (originally referring to the influence of the stars on the prevalence of the disease), from Medieval Latin influentia.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A common acute viral infection of the respiratory tract, characterized by fever, muscular aches, and catarrh, often occurring in epidemics.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种常见的急性病毒性呼吸道感染，其特征是发烧、肌肉酸痛和鼻炎，常以流行形式出现。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many people get vaccinated against influenza every year to prevent serious illness.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多人每年都会接种流感疫苗，以预防严重疾病。

REGISTER: formal or medical context; 'flu' is more common in everyday speech.
